(51) 1903rd July, 1951CABINETCONVERSATIONS ON MATTERS OF FOREIGN policy note by the Prime minister in paragraph 41 of the current notes on procedure for Ministers(CP. (49) 95), I reminded my colleagues of the need for care in conversa-tions at Embassy functions; and I asked them to make a note of any such conversations on matters of foreign policy and to send a copy to theForeign Secretary.Equal care should be exercised in all conversations with representa-tives of foreign countries, no matter where they occur or how private orinformal they may be. ' And, when questions of foreign policy are discussed, the Foreign Secretary should be promptly, informed.C. R. A.3110, Downing Street, SWA,3rd July, 1951.
